title: Plastics: Material-Specific Data | US EPA
body: Learn about the generation, recycling, composting, combustion and landfilling of plastic materials in municipal solid waste (MSW) in the United States. See the overview table and graph of plastics waste management by weight from 1960 to 2018, and the sources of data on plastics recycling rates and trends.
readable_content:
**Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) - Plastics: Material-Specific Data**

*Published on EPA website*  
*Last updated on April 21, 2023*

Here, you can find detailed information and data on plastics, their generation, recycling, composting, combustion with energy recovery, and landfilling in the United States. The data reflects trends from 1960 to 2018, providing insights into the management of plastics in municipal solid waste.

- Thanks for sharing this. The data on plastics generation, recycling, and disposal is quite comprehensive. It provides a clear picture of the environmental impact of plastics in the United States.

Source: [EPA - Facts and Figures about Materials, Waste and Recycling](https://archive.epa.gov/epawaste/nonhaz/municipal/web/html/#Plastics)
summary:
The conversation is focused on providing detailed information and data on plastics, their generation, recycling, composting, combustion, and landfilling in the United States. The individual is appreciative of the comprehensive data on plastics' environmental impact. The sentiment is positive, with an emphasis on the importance of understanding the environmental impact of plastics. 

Sentiment: 0.8
